ImageData.LabelName: Stage IIIB Adenocarcinoma of the Esophagus (1)
Cancer in 3 to 6 lymph nodes near tumor
Cancer in 1 to 6 lymph nodes near tumor

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Aligned the two lymph node labels on the bottom of the image

Separated the brackets around the mucosa layer and thin muscle layer; in the left panel, extended the cancer spot in the thick muscle layer down to Â¼ inch below the white dividing line between the two main layers of the thick muscle layer; added OR between the two panels.
Revisions made to image per AJCC 8th edition staging

Changed brackets to curly brackets with the label line pointing to the middle of the bracket; added label for Submucosa, pointing to the white band near the top, and made the mucosa layer just include the layers from the top of the submucosa to the top of the image; and made the connective tissue layer at the very bottom a little thicker.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IIIB adenocarcinoma of the esophagus (1); drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. An inset shows the layers of the esophagus wall: the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer. The left panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, and thick muscle layer and in 3 lymph nodes near the tumor. The right panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer and in 4 lymph nodes near the tumor.

Stage IIIB adenocarcinoma of the esophagus (1); drawing shows the esophagus and stomach. An inset shows the layers of the esophagus wall: the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer. The left panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, and thick muscle layer and in 3 lymph nodes near the tumor. The right panel shows cancer in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer and in 4 lymph nodes near the tumor.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IIIB adenocarcinoma of the esophagus (1). Cancer has spread into the thick muscle layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 3 to 6 lymph nodes near the tumor; OR cancer has spread into the connective tissue layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 1 to 6 lymph nodes near the tumor.

Stage IIIB adenocarcinoma of the esophagus (1). Cancer has spread into the thick muscle layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 3 to 6 lymph nodes near the tumor; OR cancer has spread into the connective tissue layer of the esophagus wall. Cancer is found in 1 to 6 lymph nodes near the tumor.
